com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware

Interface LegacyModule

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HardwareDevice

    public interface LegacyModule
extends HardwareDevice
    Legacy Module for working with NXT devices

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  LegacyModule.PortReadyCallback
      Callback interface for port ready notifications If a device needs to be notified when a port is ready this interface can be used.

    • Method Detail

      • enableNxtI2cReadMode

        void enableNxtI2cReadMode(int physicalPort,
                          int i2cAddress,
                          int memAddress,
                          int length)
        Enable a physical port in NXT I2C read mode
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device
        i2cAddress - I2C address
        memAddress - memory address on the device
        length - length of memory to access, in bytes

      • enableNxtI2cWriteMode

        void enableNxtI2cWriteMode(int physicalPort,
                           int i2cAddress,
                           int memAddress,
                           int length)
        Enable a physical port in NXT I2C write mode
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device
        i2cAddress - I2C address
        memAddress - memory address on the device
        length - length of memory to access, in bytes

      • enableAnalogReadMode

        void enableAnalogReadMode(int physicalPort)
        Enable a physical port in analog read mode
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device

      • enable9v

        void enable9v(int physicalPort,
              boolean enable)
        Enable or disable 9V power on a port
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device
        enable - true to enable; false to disable

      • setDigitalLine

        void setDigitalLine(int physicalPort,
                    int line,
                    boolean set)
        Set the value of digital line 0 or 1 while in analog mode.

        These are port pins 5 and 6.

        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device
        line - line 0 or 1
        set - true to set; otherwise false

      • readAnalog

        byte[] readAnalog(int physicalPort)
        Read an analog value from a device; only works in analog read mode
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device
        Returns:
        byte[] containing the two analog values; low byte first, high byte second

      • getI2cReadCacheLock

        java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock getI2cReadCacheLock(int physicalPort)
        Get the lock that is used to protect the I2C read cache
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device
        Returns:
        lock

        java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock getI2cWriteCacheLock(int physicalPort)
        Get the lock that is used to protect the I2C write cache
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device
        Returns:

        Get the cache that I2C reads will be populated into
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        byte array

        Returns:

      • setNxtI2cPortActionFlag

        void setNxtI2cPortActionFlag(int physicalPort)
        Set the port action flag; this flag tells the legacy module to send the current data in its buffer to the NXT I2C device
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device

      • isNxtI2cPortActionFlagSet

        boolean isNxtI2cPortActionFlagSet(int physicalPort)
        Get the port action flag; this flag is set if the particular port is busy.
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device

      • readI2cCacheFromModule

        void readI2cCacheFromModule(int physicalPort)
        Read the I2C cache in from the Legacy Module NOTE: unless this method is called the internal cache isn't updated
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device

      • writeI2cCacheToModule

        void writeI2cCacheToModule(int physicalPort)
        Write the I2C cache to the Legacy Module NOTE: unless this method is called the internal cache isn't updated
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device

      • writeI2cPortFlagOnlyToModule

        void writeI2cPortFlagOnlyToModule(int physicalPort)
        Write just the port action flag in the legacy module's cache to the I2C device
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device

      • isI2cPortInReadMode

        boolean isI2cPortInReadMode(int physicalPort)
        Is the port in read mode?
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device
        Returns:
        true if in read mode; otherwise false

      • isI2cPortInWriteMode

        boolean isI2cPortInWriteMode(int physicalPort)
        Is the port in write mode?
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device
        Returns:
        true if in write mode; otherwise false

      • registerForPortReadyCallback

        void registerForPortReadyCallback(LegacyModule.PortReadyCallback callback,
                                  int port)
        Register to be notified when a given port is ready. The callback method will be called after the latest data has been read from the Legacy Module. Only one callback can be registered for a given port. Last to register wins.
        Parameters:
        callback - register a callback
        port - port to be monitored

      • deregisterForPortReadyCallback

        void deregisterForPortReadyCallback(int port)
        De-register for port ready notifications.
        Parameters:
        port -

      • isI2cPortReady

        boolean isI2cPortReady(int physicalPort)
        Determine if a physical port is ready
        Parameters:
        physicalPort - physical port number on the device
        Returns:
        true if ready for command; false otherwise
